Detailed Description

Mute Daemon.

Author:
Mark Spencer <markster@digium.com>
Updated for Mac OSX CoreAudio
  • Josh Roberson <josh@asteriasgi.com>
Note:
Specially written for Malcolm Davenport, but I think I'll use it too Connects to the Asterisk Manager Interface, AMI, and listens for events on certain devices. If a phone call is connected to one of the devices (phones) the local sound is muted to a lower volume during the call.

Definition in file muted.c.

00599             strncpy(channel, resp + strlen("Channel: "), sizeof(channel) - 1);
00600          if (!strncasecmp(resp, "Newname: ", strlen("Newname: ")))
00601             strncpy(newname, resp + strlen("Newname: "), sizeof(newname) - 1);
00602          if (!strncasecmp(resp, "Oldname: ", strlen("Oldname: ")))
00603             strncpy(oldname, resp + strlen("Oldname: "), sizeof(oldname) - 1);
00604       }
00605       if (strlen(channel)) {
00606          if (!strcasecmp(event, "Hangup")) 
00607             hangup_chan(channel);
00608          else
00609             offhook_chan(channel);
00610       }
00611       if (strlen(newname) && strlen(oldname)) {
00612          if (!strcasecmp(event, "Rename")) {
00613             hangup_chan(oldname);
00614             offhook_chan(newname);
00615          }
00616       }
00617    } else {
00618       /* Consume the rest of the non-event */
00619       while((resp = get_line()) && strlen(resp));
00620    }
00621    if (!resp) {
00622       fprintf(stderr, "disconnected (7)\n");
00623       return -1;
00624    }
00625    return 0;
00626 }
